textAfterTable: Showing 11 results of 11 Flat | Threaded Re: [Fail2ban-users] development? From: René Berber <rberber@ca...> - 2010-09-16 21:38:52 On 9/16/2010 4:17 PM, Roy Sigurd Karlsbakk wrote: > is fail2ban still in development or is it stagnant or dormant? i > posted some patches to make it work with solaris, and still haven't > got any feedback. there are also issues with tcpwrappers-based bans, > where those aren't being cancelled after the ban time. > > please update me on this - if the project is still alive Its alive and stable, so don't expect many changes. Why do you expect feedback? The Solaris service integration was a third-party addition as far as I remember, yours looks pretty bad quality, I don't want to review anything but it looks like you don't really know fail2ban, nor Solaris. I have used the tcp-wrappers part for a long time with no problem (in Solaris, Linux, and Windows), they are banned and unbanned as expected. -- René Berber Re: [Fail2ban-users] tai64n trouble From: René Berber <rberber@ca...> - 2010-09-16 21:32:13
